title: How to Make Apple Cider Tea Bread

steps.headline: Line the loaf pan with parchment paper.
Pour the flour, salt and spice into a mixing bowl.
Rub the butter into the dry ingredients with the tips of your fingers.
steps.description: When it resembles fine breadcrumbs, add the sugar, apple and cider-soaked raisins.

steps.headline: Add the eggs and mix well.
Pour the cake mixture into the loaf pan.
steps.description: Place in the oven and bake for around 50-60 minutes. It's ready when it looks golden and a skewer or toothpick inserted into it comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and turn onto a wire rack.
Make the glaze.
steps.description: Pour the ingredients into a saucepan and boil for 3-4 minutes. Brush the glaze over the warm tea bread.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF or 180ºC.  Line the loaf pan with parchment paper.  Pour the flour, salt and spice into a mixing bowl.  Rub the butter into the dry ingredients with the tips of your fingers. When it resembles fine breadcrumbs, add the sugar, apple and cider-soaked raisins. Add the eggs and mix well.  Pour the cake mixture into the loaf pan. Place in the oven and bake for around 50-60 minutes. It's ready when it looks golden and a skewer or toothpick inserted into it comes out clean. Remove from the oven and turn onto a wire rack.  Make the glaze. Pour the ingredients into a saucepan and boil for 3-4 minutes. Brush the glaze over the warm tea bread. Serve slightly warm. Provide butter for choice.
